title: Healthy Sleep: Foundation of Mental Well-being
preview: How to improve sleep quality for better mental health
content:
Quality sleep is the foundation of mental and physical health. Poor sleep can worsen symptoms of anxiety, depression, and stress.

## Importance of Sleep for Mental Health

Sleep plays a critical role in:
- Memory consolidation
- Emotion regulation
- Nervous system recovery
- Immune system maintenance
- Stress hormone regulation

## Signs of Sleep Problems

- Difficulty falling asleep
- Frequent nighttime awakenings
- Early awakening without being able to fall back asleep
- Feeling tired after sleep
- Daytime sleepiness

## Strategies to Improve Sleep

### 1. Maintain Sleep Schedule
Go to bed and wake up at the same time every day, including weekends.

### 2. Create Bedtime Ritual
Develop a relaxing ritual 30-60 minutes before sleep:
- Warm bath or shower
- Reading a book
- Meditation or breathing exercises
- Light stretching

### 3. Optimize Bedroom
- Temperature: 18-20Â°C
- Complete darkness
- Minimal noise
- Comfortable mattress and pillows

### 4. Limit Screen Time
Avoid screens 1-2 hours before sleep. Blue light suppresses melatonin production.

### 5. Watch Your Diet
- Avoid caffeine after 2 PM
- Don't eat heavy meals 3 hours before sleep
- Limit alcohol

### 6. Physical Activity
Regular exercise improves sleep quality, but avoid intense workouts 3-4 hours before sleep.

## When to Seek Help

If sleep problems persist for more than a month and affect quality of life, consult a sleep or mental health specialist.
